description: <p>University College London Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust<br /><br />The UCLH FELLOWSHIP in PERIOPERATIVE MEDICINE (ST5+ LEVEL)<br /><br />Full time – 1 year Fixed Term Appointments<br /><br />Commencing February 2021<br /><br />Candidates are invited to apply for our new and exciting posts aimed at senior trainees / post-CCT doctors in Anaesthesia/Critical Care Medicine.   We offer a one-year fixed term contract to train in all aspects of Perioperate Care to Royal College of Anaesthetists Advanced level.The post is to develop future leaders in this exciting and emerging field.  Start date Wednesday 3rd February 2021.<br /><br />Based on our new Ehance Perioperative Care Unit at University College Hospital, successful candidates will partake in an innovative programme aimed delivering a model of care for high-risk patients contemplating, undergoing and recovering from major surgery.  Clinical duties include being the senior fellow on the (care levels, 1 - 3) under the supervision of Perioperative Care consultant. This post will be an opportunity to be part of an innovative perioperative medicine team, managing high-risk surgical patients in conjunction with colleagues including, surgeons and elderly care physicians .  Fellows will also undertake supervised preoperative assessment and CPET clinic training and working in our specialist surgical elderly care clinic.  Successful candidates will follow NELA patients from admission to discharge and be expected to develop their clinical competencies in a wide range of technical and non-technical skills.<br /><br />The key feature of the post is the opportunity to undertake the funded UCL MSc. in Perioperative Medicine.<br /><br />In addition, fellows will have the opportunity to undertake supervised clinical research with departmental clinical scientists.  Substantial time is allocated within the weekly programme for both MSc and research activities, built in to a rolling programme of education and training.  Additionally, opportunities exist for those wishing to accredit in trans-thoracic echocardiography (BSE level-1), participate in the development of master’s level education and a number of other translational research projects.  The rota is banded at 1A.<br /><br />UK and overseas students are encouraged to apply, and all applicants must be eligible for full GMC registration and have a background in Anaesthesia/Critical Care Medicine, having achieved competencies to ST5 training year and FRCA (or equivalent).  UK based trainees must seek approval for OOPE and will be supported in applications to the RCoA and GMC for OOPT / OOPR approval as appropriate.<br /><br />In support of patients undergoing surgical intensive care, previous critical care experience is essential for this post.<br />For further details / informal visits contact:<br /><br />Prospective candidates are encouraged to visit the hospital.  For further information or to arrange a visit to the department, please contact Professor David Walker via email: d.walker@ucl.ac.uk<br /><br />Closing Date – 4 weeks</p>
